Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's Britney bitch. And I am back, in the form of a new company. The Michael Scott Paper Company. [tries to parallel park, hits car.] Okay. Not gonna make this one. [drives away revealing plenty of space for the Cruiser]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: LOVE the hair. [Ryan walks up driveway with blonde dyed hair]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Morning Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello! They took away my parking space but they can't take away my pride! [awkwardly climbs out of his car]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like to invite you all to come away with me, on a journey. [nips mylar ribbon with hedge clippers, it won't cut, he tears it down] Welcome! To the Michael Scott Paper Company!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So. I thought we could take the customer on a... Then. Then we could...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You realize you're not actually talking to me, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And...

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hey Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes? Charles, you wanted me?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Oh, I meant, I meant that Kelly. [New receptionist walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The new receptionist is also named Kelly. So Kelly Kapoor has decided to hover around my desk, so that she can run into his Charles' office every time he calls for Kelly. She thinks if she says "You wanted me" enough, he will in fact want her. It's not the worse plan she's ever had.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Oh, and Kelly...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes Charles? Yes, you wanted me?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm gonna call you Kapoor, okay? And you, Hannon.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: If we're changing names, can I be Erin? It's my middle name.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Erin. Okay, that's very pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well you know what my middle name is? Rajani Ghana! And I hate it! I hate it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I thought Rajini Ghanda was a boy's name?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are in the heart of it. [Bathroom sounds rattle the small office.] And the surge of water carries our business out to the sea.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What should we do now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We wait, and hope that people show up to the pancake luncheon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know I think we've done absolutely everything you can do to prepare for the day. I've updated our contacts, I have gotten quotes from suppliers. I have sent out an E-vite for our big grand opening pancake luncheon. Six yeses, one maybe, only eleven noes. Um, and 788 not yet replieds. But of that group, 782 have viewed it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to need 800 of these, on nice bright paper. It is a coupon for unparalleled customer service. [He sets sheet between Pam and Ryan on desk. Neither takes it.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I make that one copy, and I become the girl who makes copies, and by the end of the day I'm receptionist again. And the worst part is, I like making copies. The paper comes out all warm and stuff. And it's cold in there. Cause it's technically a closet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me check. [Pulls out hunting scope] Oh nope! Clearly a hunter. Who knows how to throw an outfit together.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I am taking Andy hunting after work. Not long ago we were sexual competitors. I used to hate him, hate him, hate him, hate him. I studied him, to figure out why I hated him so much. But that blossomed into a very real friendship, as these things often do.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You should come into town this weekend man. Yeah, we'll hang out Scranton style.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey you said you were gonna be out of town this weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Please don't listen to my phone calls. Yeah, she's like um, she'd probably be a Six in New York, but she's like a Seven here in Scranton. And then uh, my boss is my old boss from Dunder Mifflin. It's a small space.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hey Jim can I get a, um-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi! [Awkward]

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hi. I need a rundown of your clients, can you get that to me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure!

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What the hell's a rundown?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When did you need that rundown by?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: As soon as possible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Just get it right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Gotcha. Of course. I'm gonna dive in. To the rundown. I'll be exhausted 'cause it's like a triathlon. [At door.] Do you want to close this? Close, or keep it?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know there's a ghost in this office

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A woman was murdered on this very floor in 1816. Haddie McGonagle. She was a prostitute.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Why was she in this building?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, this whole place used to be a brothel. There was a tavern on the ground floor.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah isn't it? She was bludgeoned to death by the business end of a riding crop.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was gruesome. They say she walks these hallways. If you ever feel a tapping on your shoulder?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That could be Haddie. Begging for her life. And it could mean, that you're next. [Taps her shoulder]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh! [Dwight and Erin laugh.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just kidding. You finding everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Just got some ice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Erin [eerie voice] Erin...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, this is awkward. [Andy and Erin 'dance' trying to get out of each other's way]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oops!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh oh! Oh! Oh! [Andy improvs musical verbage]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So I'll see you guys around!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Ryan? [Ryan watches Montgomery Flea Market ad on YouTube] Could you get to that copy from before?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Pam's better at that stuff

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That is so insulting.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How is it insulting to say that you're good at something?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because the thing you're saying I'm good at, is pushing a big green button a bunch of times.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm not judging it, it's like ... I could run GM but I couldn't fix a car. It's not saying one is better than the other.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Seriously? Because it sounds like one of those is better than the other.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What the hell? [Michael closed his laptop]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen. Listen listen listen listen listen listen. I need someone to make a copy of this. Because I don't make copies, I'm the boss. Got it? I make originals.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah I make originals too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shut up!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it stop it! Bickering! Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Not much? What's up with you? [from bathroom above] Nah it's okay. I'm in the bathroom. Hey you been watching Damages this year? It's so good. No, you gotta tune in, it's as good as anything on HBO. [sound of pissing] Hey does blue go with tan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would someone just make the copy?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I have like, like a blue shirt? I don't wear a lot of colors, I have a lot of tan. Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just make that copy okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Seriously? This is what's so important, putting naked pictures on the desktop?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's me and my friend Jonathan from Thailand.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't want to look at your friend Jasmine's boobs all day.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You could be hot too if you made any effort. At all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Like how? Dyeing my hair blond?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is from the sun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh yeah I bet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're getting on my nerves Mom. Both of them. R thinks he's too good to be here, and P is not as much fun without Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, we can hear you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm on the phone, please. Mom, I'm gonna have to call you back. P's being a giant B.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay it's my turn.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No don't take that, give that back!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Give it back for what? What're you gonna do with it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm gonna make a spreadsheet.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're gonna make another "spreadsheet."

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah exactly. It's my turn.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Go make a copy, secretary.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on! Ryan!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They always say that it is a mistake to hire your friends and they are right! So, I hired my best friends. And this is what I get?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey buddy, what are you up to?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, nerthing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen, when I saw you talking to Erin earlier, I noticed that your pupils dilated, and your skin flushed, and I'm assuming, a little bit of blood rushed into your penis.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pffft.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, a little bit of blood rushed into mine as well, so where does that leave us?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The last thing I want to do, is step on your funk man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I, yours. So I will cede her to you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, that's ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No no no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Look you've been here longer, and besides, I'm a better wingman than I am a boyfriend so-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look I just want you and I to hang out so, you know. Just, [They Hi-5 badly] Boom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen up. It has come to my attention that some people in this office are not getting along with other people in this office. And I think I have come up with the reason why. This office space is too small.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. There are ... 4 corners in this room. Each corner is to be a personal space for each one of you. Whichever corner you want. And make it your own.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We could work from home.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Or you could fire one of us. Whoever has less education.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay guys, thank you for the offers. But I want you to get pumped about this corner idea. All right? 1,2,3- What are we gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: .... Corner idea?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you're supposed to say, "Rock the house."

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Rock the house!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How would we know that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey dude, you know what a "rundown" is?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Use it in a sentence.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "Uh, can you get this rundown for me?" [impersonating Charles]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Try another sentence.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "This rundown better be really good"?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know but it sounds like the rundown is really important.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Charles asked me to do this rundown of all my clients.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why don't you just ask him-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. I can't. It was like, hours ago.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What have you been doing?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Try it in another sentence.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Last night was crazy. Jojo? Yeah. He did a donut in a parking lot in front of a cop. And then he yells, "Hey cop, you like donuts?" then we drive off. No, he just stayed there. [Pam goes to sit in a chair in the corner.] I want that new phone. No, the other one. No the other one. No, you know which one I'm talking about it's the one, the one with the awesome browser. [More bathroom noises] No, not that one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's my corner.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I thought that was your corner.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, this is where I work. I can't relax in the same corner where I work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So my corner's the one with the copier?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, I don't make the rules. [Pam walks out.]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. I wish my iPod could make phone calls. No I don't want an iPhone, I know what an iPhone is.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: You started on that rundown yet? [Looks at Jim's screen.]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, this is just something I'm taking a break with.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I will get back to the rundown, uh, right now.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey you know what? Do you have a rundown that I could take a look at, just so I know what type of rundown you're looking for ?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Just keep it simple.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Keeping it simple -that's what I'm doing. But I am working hard on this one. Real hard.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: You're working hard? On this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Not too hard. Not harder than I should.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Right. I mean why work harder than you should.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey I'm here to see Charles.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Charles.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hey Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know you're a very busy man so I'll cut right to the chase. I'd like my old job back.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I don't know what to tell you. The job's been taken.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, well, I could come back as a salesman. I have experience now.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Um.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or I could come back as your personal assistant. You know? Sort your mail, set your appointments. I know all the people.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yeah I know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Personal shopper?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well it was great catching up with you. And I'll see you around the building.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna sit here for a little bit longer if that's okay. The air smells so good. I don't remember it smelling so good. The chairs are so comfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh hey! Stanley, Phyllis. Come on in. Welcome, welcome. Let me give you the tour.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I get it. [To Phyllis] You need to see more?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's really cute.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. You remember Ryan [Stanley laughs deeply] And Pam is around here somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: She's upstairs talking to Charles.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What for?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't know. [They shrug and leave.]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Are we staying til five?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe the Michael Scott Paper Company was a huge mistake. I should leave. I should go, and start my own paper company. That'll show 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get your free pancakes. They are delicious. They are nutritious. They are complimentary. [Flips a pancake. It's about 8×11 inches] Young sir, would you like a free pancake?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm texting. I don't want to get my fingers sticky.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan, enough with the texting machine. Come on. And tuck in your shirt, you're the face of this company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You sorta disappeared there for a while. Where ya been?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I needed to take care of some stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's as specific as I'd like to be.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, at least you're still being honest with me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's the rundown you asked for. I may have expanded some areas that you weren't prepared for.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Great. Fax that to everyone on the distribution list.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah sure. You want to look at it first?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Do I need to?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. No, I just wanted to make sure, it was in the same format. So that distribution list is gonna be my...?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The one I have. I'll use the one I have.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just faxing. My Dad. A rundown.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're small, but we're eager to make a name for ourselves.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Do you have a card?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope, I don't have a card, but I'll do you one better. A little scrap of paper.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: These are terrible boss. You gotta make them in a circle so that they cook evenly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: These are shaped like paper.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Well I don't even want these. [Takes the rectangle pancakes out of his coat.]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'll take them for my kid.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Country roads, take me home, to the place...[Dwight is strumming the tune on his guitar] Sorry. I like that song. You're good!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're good.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That was great, but it's just sort of, it's still a little choppy like. But don't worry, it's hard, it took me a while too. It's like [Andy plays Country Roads on his banjo.]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? Oh my God you heard that I'm so embarrassed. I'm like so rusty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh it's good, you're coming along. It's really technically proficient but really there's no heart or soul in it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight plays a hearty strum of the song, Andy stands and starts a banjo solo]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey you want to sing with me? Almost heaven...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Erin
Quote.Text: West Virginia, Blue Ridge mountain, Shenandoah River [Andy vocalizes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In German! Leben ist dort alt, alter als die Baume, Junger als die Berge, wie eine Brise blasend

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Andy
Quote.Text: Take me home, country roads, to the place, I belong. West Virginia, mountain momma, take me home, country roads. [Erin leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Take it Andy! Take me home, to the place I belong, Ba bah dah duh

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You have to stop. [bangs on glass window]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Michael sits alone at the pancake table alone, the breeze blowing paper around.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I once had a dream. That I was eating a peanut butter and tuna fish sandwich. And, let me tell you something it was delicious. So the next day, I decided to make that sandwich. And in real life it is disgusting. [The phone rings] It is a disgusting sandwich. [It rings again.] And the reason I tell you this story. [phone] Pick up the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Miff...Michael Scott Paper Company, this is Pam. Oh, hi Russell from the pancake luncheon, how are you? Well we'd like to do business with you too! How can we make that happen?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Keep going. [Whispers]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't tell them we have free delivery! [Also whispers]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We already offered free delivery!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They don't know that!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I can offer you free delivery on any order that you place today. Okay, twenty boxes? I can do... just a second. I can do 20 boxes at 43 dollars a box. Great!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Write it down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give him a guarantee.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A guarantee of what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just say the word.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And I guarantee, that you will be satisfied! 'Cause your satisfaction is our guarantee! We guarantee it. We look forward to doing business with you too. Thank you Russell.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I made a sale!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You did!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We did it !

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She did it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! [Dancing in the office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who would have thought, that the thing that would save this company would be work? And pancakes? In the end, this day definitely had its ups and downs. I realize that we don't have the biggest office. Which is a surprise, because 165 square feet sounds like a lot. But, we have people with the biggest hearts. And I think for a small company that is really [flushing] Someone went to the bathroom. That is really what's important.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Literally every song is better a cappella. Name a song.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cherry Pie, Warrant.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Better a cappella!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Name another.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Enter Sandman, Metallica.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Better a cappella.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Rebel Yell, Billy Idol

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aw!! Way better a cappella

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.
